text: is a Japanese former cyclist. He competed in two events at the 1992 Summer Olympics. He rode for Shimano during his career and won the mountains competition at the 1994 Tour de Hokkaido. He worked for the Shimano company after retiring. ==References== Category:1969 births Category:Living people Category:Japanese male cyclists Category:Olympic cyclists of Japan Category:Cyclists at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:Sportspeople from Osaka Prefecture Category:Cyclists at the 1990 Asian Games Category:Asian Games medalists in cycling Category:Asian Games gold medalists for Japan Category:Asian Games silver medalists for Japan Category:Medalists at the 1990 Asian Games
title: Masamitsu Ehara
